goal: Prepare the plugin for production by removing all development-only artifacts, tests, and temporary files created during the enhancement process. Ensure the plugin is clean, lightweight, and contains only necessary production code.

instructions.details: Delete all PHP files inside the /tests/ directory, including test-task-14-enhancements.php and similar. These were used for local validation only and are not needed in production.

instructions.action: Remove unused REST API registration code
instructions.condition: Only if no templates or features consume the custom endpoint.
instructions.details: The plugin uses internal data access (`PropertyData::get_property_data()`) and does not expose or use the custom REST endpoint in the frontend or admin UI. Confirm and remove endpoint code if it's unused.

Scan the PropertyData class and identify duplicated or unused private methods (e.g., image handling logic). If `gallery_urls` or `featured_url` are handled by one clean method, remove the older or fallback logic.

instructions.action: Remove debug logs or internal dev-only comments
instructions.details: Delete any `error_log()` calls, `@todo`, or `@debug` comments left behind from testing phases. Replace with clean docblocks if necessary.

instructions.action: Preserve only the final set of fields
instructions.details: Keep the 28 production fields returned by `get_property_data()`. Remove any extra meta fields or legacy compatibility code if not used by current templates.
Preserve the final working HTML, CSS, and JS for the Swiper gallery with thumbnail navigation. This is confirmed as production-ready.

instructions.action: Do not remove or rename any core classes or functions
instructions.details: Maintain backward compatibility for existing consumers of PropertyData or agent templates.

output: Cleaned-up plugin directory, with only production-ready code, classes, assets, and templates. All unused files, test scripts, and dev logs must be removed.
